data: {"title":"Daniel Sturridge spots what Mo Salah was doing before Liverpool against Man City","description":"The former Premier League player was part of Sky Sports' broadcast team","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-man-city-daniel-sturridge-789436-20241201","content":"Daniel Sturridge spots what Mo Salah was doing before Liverpool against Man City - Liverpool - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Daniel Sturridge noticed exactly what Mohamed Salah was doing before Liverpool against Manchester City.**

[Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-mo-salah-contract-jamie-carragher-475131-20241125), 32, was part of Arne Slot's starting XI for the crunch match at Anfield on Sunday afternoon.

However, it was Salah's 'pre-match ritual' that the former England striker could not help but comment on.

Advert

As the camera inside the tunnel at Anfield panned to Salah just minutes before kick-off, the Egyptian could be seen crouched down away from his [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) teammates.

Whether this is something he usually does is unclear.

Sturridge was accompanied by Micah Richards and [Roy Keane](https://www.sportbible.com/roy-keane), who joked that the Reds' winger was thinking about his new contract.

Advert

"He's probably meditating - he does that before matches," explained Sturridge.

Salah did not take long to effect the game, setting up Cody Gakpo for the opening goal on the 12-minute mark.

But he is not the only person involved with Liverpool who has an interesting ritual ahead of games.

According to [Mail Sport](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-14115185/Arne-Slot-LEWIS-STEELE-flying-Dutchman-Liverpool-Jurgen-Klopp.html?ns_mchannel=rss&ito=1490&ns_campaign=1490&utm_medium=facebook&utm_campaign=auto-liverpool&utm_source=social), Arne Slot [has a superstition](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/champions-league/liverpool-arne-slot-superstition-519356-20241125) which involves avoiding looking at the clock at exactly 13.13 (1:13 or am) for several years, as he believes the number can mean bad luck.

Advert

And rather fittingly, Liverpool do not currently have a number '13' as part of their squad.

![Image 1: Mo Salah provided the assist for Cody Gakpo's goal against Man City (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blte09805a4931a240d/674c8eec007fb55ab9b396d3/GettyImages-2187713484.jpg)

Mo Salah provided the assist for Cody Gakpo's goal against Man City (Credit:Getty)

Despite Salah's performances on the pitch impressing the Anfield faithful, they will hoping his contractual situation is resolved sooner rather than later.

The former Chelsea man's current Liverpool deal is set to expire on June 30, 2025.

Advert

After last Sunday's 3-2 win away at Southampton he gave his thoughts to the gathered media outside St Mary's, even admitting he was "more out than in" when discussing his future.

"We are almost in December and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club," Salah said.

"I'm probably more out than in."

When further questioned if he was disappointed at the situation, Salah replied: "Of course, yeah.

Advert

"I'm not going to retire soon so I'm just playing, focusing on the season and I'm trying to win the Premier League and hopefully the Champions League as well. I'm disappointed but we will see."

[Virgil van Dijk](https://www.sportbible.com/virgil-van-dijk)'s and Trent [Alexander-Arnold](https://www.sportbible.com/trent-alexander-arnold)'s contracts are also set to expire this summer.

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Jamie Carragher has pointed out a flaw in Gary Neville’s proposed rule change for the Premier League – but both have a point.**

[Carragher](https://www.sportbible.com/jamie-carragher), 46, and [Neville](https://www.sportbible.com/gary-neville), 49, have become an unlikely duo on British television screens as they regularly work together on Sky Sports’ Premier League coverage.

Last night, Neville was present at the London Stadium for [Arsenal](https://www.sportbible.com/arsenal)’s 5-2 trouncing of West Ham United.

Advert

Neville regularly voices his opinions on all on and off-pitch matters related to football, but his latest suggestion will ring true with fans of most clubs.

With the scores at 5-2, both sides made changes at half-time, with Edson Alvarez replacing Crysencio Summerville for West Ham, while Arsenal’s Jakub Kiwior replaced Gabriel Magalhães in the Gunners’ defence.

On 56 minutes, Oleksandr Zinchenko was introduced in place of Riccardo Calafiori before nine minutes later, the Hammers replaced goal scorer Emerson with Vladimir Coufal, and Danny Ings came on for Michail Antonio.

Advert

Then, to the dismay of Neville, Arsenal made two more changes just nine minutes later, Raheem Sterling and Gabriel Jesus came on for Bukayo Saka and Martin Odegaard.

And in theme with the second half, the Irons waited three minutes before making another double substitution of their own when Guido Rodriguez replaced Lucas Pacqueta and Andy Irving came on for Carlos Soler.

Then, just seven minutes later, Arsenal youngster Ethan Nwaneri was introduced in place of Leandro Trossard.

![Image 1: Gary Neville suggested a rule change (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt93c318f5991ebb65/674c7d659b46e32574eba368/GettyImages-1247818897.jpg)

Gary Neville suggested a rule change (Credit:Getty)

Advert

Of course, both sides were acting within the laws of the game by making five substitutions each – but Neville had seemingly seen enough.

"The rhythm of the game just gets broken with all these subs,” said an annoyed-sounding Neville.

From the 2022/23 season, teams were allowed a further two substitutions (previously allowed three changes), which could take place in three blocks.

Neville previously suggested the idea of ‘rolling substitutions’ on [The Overlap](https://www.youtube.com/@TheOverlap) brought to you by [Sky Bet](https://m.skybet.com/).

Advert

Several other sports, including basketball and handball use the method.

"Let the fourth official manage substitutions so that the game doesn't have to stop, and you can just run on and off," he said.

"So basically, (Martin) Odegaard's coming on for (Leandro) Trossard, the fourth official's there, he gets a message to Trossard, 'you're off' and Trossard comes off."

However, Carragher was not totally convinced by the idea.

Advert

“You (a player on the pitch) wouldn't look at the bench, would you?” said Carragher.

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

**Jamie Carragher has pointed out a flaw in Gary Neville’s proposed rule change for the Premier League – but both have a point.**

[Carragher](https://www.sportbible.com/jamie-carragher), 46, and [Neville](https://www.sportbible.com/gary-neville), 49, have become an unlikely duo on British television screens as they regularly work together on Sky Sports’ Premier League coverage.

Last night, Neville was present at the London Stadium for [Arsenal](https://www.sportbible.com/arsenal)’s 5-2 trouncing of West Ham United.

Advert

Neville regularly voices his opinions on all on and off-pitch matters related to football, but his latest suggestion will ring true with fans of most clubs.

Credit: The Overlap

With the scores at 5-2, both sides made changes at half-time, with Edson Alvarez replacing Crysencio Summerville for West Ham, while Arsenal’s Jakub Kiwior replaced Gabriel Magalhães in the Gunners’ defence.

On 56 minutes, Oleksandr Zinchenko was introduced in place of Riccardo Calafiori before nine minutes later, the Hammers replaced goal scorer Emerson with Vladimir Coufal, and Danny Ings came on for Michail Antonio.

Advert

Then, to the dismay of Neville, Arsenal made two more changes just nine minutes later, Raheem Sterling and Gabriel Jesus came on for Bukayo Saka and Martin Odegaard.

And in theme with the second half, the Irons waited three minutes before making another double substitution of their own when Guido Rodriguez replaced Lucas Pacqueta and Andy Irving came on for Carlos Soler.

Then, just seven minutes later, Arsenal youngster Ethan Nwaneri was introduced in place of Leandro Trossard.

![Image 1: Gary Neville suggested a rule change (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt93c318f5991ebb65/674c7d659b46e32574eba368/GettyImages-1247818897.jpg)

Gary Neville suggested a rule change (Credit:Getty)

Advert

Of course, both sides were acting within the laws of the game by making five substitutions each – but Neville had seemingly seen enough.

"The rhythm of the game just gets broken with all these subs,” said an annoyed-sounding Neville.

From the 2022/23 season, teams were allowed a further two substitutions (previously allowed three changes), which could take place in three blocks.

Neville previously suggested the idea of ‘rolling substitutions’ on [The Overlap](https://www.youtube.com/@TheOverlap) brought to you by [Sky Bet](https://m.skybet.com/).

Advert

Several other sports, including basketball and handball use the method.

"Let the fourth official manage substitutions so that the game doesn't have to stop, and you can just run on and off," he said.

"So basically, (Martin) Odegaard's coming on for (Leandro) Trossard, the fourth official's there, he gets a message to Trossard, 'you're off' and Trossard comes off."

data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim shows class in press conference and thanks Ruud van Nistelrooy for improving one of his players","description":"He credited Van Nistelrooy for his work at United.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-ruben-amorim-ruud-van-nistelrooy-utd-565254-20241201","content":"Ruben Amorim shows class in press conference and thanks Ruud van Nistelrooy for improving one of his players - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**In his latest post-match press conference, Ruben Amorim credited predecessor Ruud van Nistelrooy for helping improve one of his top performers.**

Amorim claimed his first [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) win as [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) head coach on Sunday afternoon as they sealed a comfortable 4-0 victory over [Everton](https://www.sportbible.com/everton) thanks to goals from Marcus Rashford \[2\] and Joshua Zirkzee \[2\].

United were never able to win a Premier League game by four goals during [Erik ten Hag](https://www.sportbible.com/erik-ten-hag)'s two-year reign but Amorim has managed to get the best out of his forward players in recent days, scoring seven goals in two games.

Advert

For many, the standout player since his appointment has been [Amad Diallo](https://www.sportbible.com/amad-diallo), who provided two assists against Sean Dyche's side.

After being deployed at right-wing-back in [their 1-1 draw against Ipswich Town](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-ruben-amorim-starting-xi-ipswich-873372-20241124) last month, the in-form Diallo earned plaudits from his new manager.

"I think it was very good, he \[Amad\] has improved a lot," said Amorim. "Since these three days, he improved so much defensively. He was so focused on everything, I think he did a great job."

Advert

Now, the Portuguese coach has praised Diallo further but instead of taking all the credit, he pointed in the direction of former interim manager Van Nistelrooy, who [recently took the job at Leicester City](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-leicester-city-premier-league-439229-20241129).

Speaking in his post-match press conference, [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) said: "He is really big in talent, but small in size. He did a great job but he is also has to improve."

The 39-year-old continued: "‘He was really good again. [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.sportbible.com/ruud-van-nistelrooy) helped him a lot in his games in charge and now he’s helping me. He’s in a great moment, but that moment started with Ruud. So I just take advantage of Ruud’s work with Amad."

![Image 1: Van Nistelrooy worked closely with Amad. Image credit: Getty ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt931e0fba7ccc55a4/674c9d6ca4203c2df6dbc69b/GettyImages-2168842173.jpg)

Van Nistelrooy worked closely with Amad. Image credit: Getty

Advert

Amorim wasn't done there. "He was really good defending and really good attacking so he has to continue to play like that," he added. "You could feel it in the end of the game he was really, really tired so we have to manage that and increase his physical ability.

"I’d like to take credit for it \[Amad’s pressing\], but that’s him. He’s like that. He’s smart. He’s explosive."

Van Nistelrooy, who joined United's coaching staff in the summer alongside fellow assistant Rene Hake, was ushered into the hot seat when Erik ten Hag was sacked last month.

He took charge of four matches across all competitions and stayed unbeaten with three wins and a draw. Despite his success, Amorim decided against handing the Dutchman a place in his backroom staff.

data: {"title":"Ruben Amorim shows class in press conference and thanks Ruud van Nistelrooy for improving one of his players","description":"He credited Van Nistelrooy for his work at United.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-ruben-amorim-ruud-van-nistelrooy-utd-565254-20241201","content":"Ruben Amorim shows class in press conference and thanks Ruud van Nistelrooy for improving one of his players - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**In his latest post-match press conference, Ruben Amorim credited predecessor Ruud van Nistelrooy for helping improve one of his top performers.**

Amorim claimed his first [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) win as [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) head coach on Sunday afternoon as they sealed a comfortable 4-0 victory over [Everton](https://www.sportbible.com/everton) thanks to goals from Marcus Rashford \[2\] and Joshua Zirkzee \[2\].

United were never able to win a Premier League game by four goals during [Erik ten Hag](https://www.sportbible.com/erik-ten-hag)'s two-year reign but Amorim has managed to get the best out of his forward players in recent days, scoring seven goals in two games.

Advert

For many, the standout player since his appointment has been [Amad Diallo](https://www.sportbible.com/amad-diallo), who provided two assists against Sean Dyche's side.

After being deployed at right-wing-back in [their 1-1 draw against Ipswich Town](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-ruben-amorim-starting-xi-ipswich-873372-20241124) last month, the in-form Diallo earned plaudits from his new manager.

"I think it was very good, he \[Amad\] has improved a lot," said Amorim. "Since these three days, he improved so much defensively. He was so focused on everything, I think he did a great job."

Advert

Now, the Portuguese coach has praised Diallo further but instead of taking all the credit, he pointed in the direction of former interim manager Van Nistelrooy, who [recently took the job at Leicester City](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-leicester-city-premier-league-439229-20241129).

Speaking in his post-match press conference, [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) said: "He is really big in talent, but small in size. He did a great job but he is also has to improve."

The 39-year-old continued: "‘He was really good again. [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.sportbible.com/ruud-van-nistelrooy) helped him a lot in his games in charge and now he’s helping me. He’s in a great moment, but that moment started with Ruud. So I just take advantage of Ruud’s work with Amad."

![Image 1: Van Nistelrooy worked closely with Amad. Image credit: Getty ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt931e0fba7ccc55a4/674c9d6ca4203c2df6dbc69b/GettyImages-2168842173.jpg)

Van Nistelrooy worked closely with Amad. Image credit: Getty

Advert

Amorim wasn't done there. "He was really good defending and really good attacking so he has to continue to play like that," he added. "You could feel it in the end of the game he was really, really tired so we have to manage that and increase his physical ability.

"I’d like to take credit for it \[Amad’s pressing\], but that’s him. He’s like that. He’s smart. He’s explosive."

Van Nistelrooy, who joined United's coaching staff in the summer alongside fellow assistant Rene Hake, was ushered into the hot seat when Erik ten Hag was sacked last month.

He took charge of four matches across all competitions and stayed unbeaten with three wins and a draw. Despite his success, Amorim decided against handing the Dutchman a place in his backroom staff.

data: {"title":"Man Utd fans think player's time is up after Ruben Amorim's ruthless decision","description":"A key player was left out","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/manchester-united-everton-ruben-amorim-squad-274923-20241201","content":"Man Utd fans think player's time is up after Ruben Amorim's ruthless decision - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Manchester United fans were left baffled by Ruben Amorim’s team selection for his first Premier League home match as a key player did not make the squad – and they think his time at the club could be up.**

[Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-premier-league-goncalo-gregorio-195555-20241119), 39, was greeted with a warm reception for his first Premier League home game in charge of [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united).

As ever, fans were keen to see his team selection and were surprised when [Joshua Zirkzee started ahead of Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/manchester-utd-joshua-zirkzee-rasmus-hojlund-ruben-amorim-selection-289882-20241201), who scored twice in the 3-2 win over Bodø/Glimt in the Europa League on Thursday.

Advert

Amorim put this down to ‘squad rotation’ when speaking ahead of the game.

However, fans were also left stunned when [Christian Eriksen](https://www.sportbible.com/christian-eriksen) was left out of the matchday squad despite starting last Sunday’s 1-1 draw against Ipswich Town.

The Danish midfielder did not make the 20-man squad for the fixture against Everton, which will no doubt add to the speculation regarding his future.

Advert

Eriksen is out of contract at the end of the season.

And according to [Sky Germany](https://x.com/Plettigoal/status/1862785765152809391)’s Florian Plettenberg, United are not willing to offer him a new deal – meaning he could leave as a free agent next summer.

![Image 1: Christian Eriksen could leave Man United this summer (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltd0ad89c34d6f0291/674c6e4f606894a70b8f6e11/GettyImages-2187117008.jpg)

Christian Eriksen could leave Man United this summer (Credit:Getty)

The 32-year-old has been linked with a potential move to Scottish champions Celtic, but his hefty wages (£150,000 per week, according to [Capology](https://www.capology.com/player/christian-eriksen-33648/)) could be a sticking point in any negotiations.

Advert

However, fans on social media leapt to the former Inter man’s defence with some even arguing that he had been United’s ‘best player’ so far this season.

One said: “No Eriksen in the squad is an absolute joke. He’s been our best player this season.”

Another added: “Eriksen has been arguably our player of the season but Amorim hardly includes him in our match day squad. Why?”

A third commented: “Can’t believe i’m saying this in 2025 - but we need to play Eriksen.”

Advert

While a fourth gave a different take: “I can't wait to see Manuel Ugarte replace Casemiro. Ugarte-Mainoo is the midfield pairing I want to see. Has the physical capability which the likes of Eriksen and Casemiro lack.”

A fifth explained: “Eriksen will struggle under Amorim’s system.”

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

data: {"title":"Man Utd fans think player's time is up after Ruben Amorim's ruthless decision","description":"A key player was left out","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/manchester-united-everton-ruben-amorim-squad-274923-20241201","content":"Man Utd fans think player's time is up after Ruben Amorim's ruthless decision - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Manchester United fans were left baffled by Ruben Amorim’s team selection for his first Premier League home match as a key player did not make the squad – and they think his time at the club could be up.**

[Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-premier-league-goncalo-gregorio-195555-20241119), 39, was greeted with a warm reception for his first Premier League home game in charge of [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united).

As ever, fans were keen to see his team selection and were surprised when [Joshua Zirkzee started ahead of Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/manchester-utd-joshua-zirkzee-rasmus-hojlund-ruben-amorim-selection-289882-20241201), who scored twice in the 3-2 win over Bodø/Glimt in the Europa League on Thursday.

Advert

Amorim put this down to ‘squad rotation’ when speaking ahead of the game.

However, fans were also left stunned when [Christian Eriksen](https://www.sportbible.com/christian-eriksen) was left out of the matchday squad despite starting last Sunday’s 1-1 draw against Ipswich Town.

The Danish midfielder did not make the 20-man squad for the fixture against Everton, which will no doubt add to the speculation regarding his future.

Advert

Eriksen is out of contract at the end of the season.

And according to [Sky Germany](https://x.com/Plettigoal/status/1862785765152809391)’s Florian Plettenberg, United are not willing to offer him a new deal – meaning he could leave as a free agent next summer.

![Image 1: Christian Eriksen could leave Man United this summer (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltd0ad89c34d6f0291/674c6e4f606894a70b8f6e11/GettyImages-2187117008.jpg)

Christian Eriksen could leave Man United this summer (Credit:Getty)

The 32-year-old has been linked with a potential move to Scottish champions Celtic, but his hefty wages (£150,000 per week, according to [Capology](https://www.capology.com/player/christian-eriksen-33648/)) could be a sticking point in any negotiations.

Advert

However, fans on social media leapt to the former Inter man’s defence with some even arguing that he had been United’s ‘best player’ so far this season.

One said: “No Eriksen in the squad is an absolute joke. He’s been our best player this season.”

Another added: “Eriksen has been arguably our player of the season but Amorim hardly includes him in our match day squad. Why?”

A third commented: “Can’t believe i’m saying this in 2025 - but we need to play Eriksen.”

Advert

While a fourth gave a different take: “I can't wait to see Manuel Ugarte replace Casemiro. Ugarte-Mainoo is the midfield pairing I want to see. Has the physical capability which the likes of Eriksen and Casemiro lack.”

A fifth explained: “Eriksen will struggle under Amorim’s system.”

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

data: {"title":"Liverpool could sign 'dazzling' Premier League player with club 'ready to accept' offer from Reds","description":"Liverpool could look to sign a player from one of their Premier League rivals to bolster their attack.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/transfer-news/liverpool-transfer-news-bournemouth-arne-slot-893467-20241201","content":"Liverpool could sign 'dazzling' Premier League player with club 'ready to accept' offer from Reds - Transfer News - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Liverpool could look to sign a player from one of their Premier League rivals to bolster their attack, it has been claimed.**

[The Reds](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) have made a near-flawless start to the campaign under Arne Slot. They are at the Premier League summit, having won 17 of their 19 games under the Dutchman.

But the Merseysiders may still look to spend in the January transfer window, to bolster their chances of claiming a first [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) title in five years and only their second since 1990.

Advert

According to [Football Insider](https://www.footballinsider247.com/bournemouth-plan-to-accept-liverpool-offer-for-antoine-semenyo-sources/) correspondent Peter O’Rourke, [Bournemouth](https://www.sportbible.com/bournemouth) are expected to entertain offers for Antoine Semenyo amid interest from [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool).

While January is unlikely, the publication has claimed the Cherries will not stand in the player’s way should he wish to make the move in the summer.

While the [Reds](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/man-city-premier-league-injury-news-setback-405641-20241201) are said to be open to signings should the right opportunity present itself in January, they are unlikely to be among the window’s biggest spenders.

Semenyo, who the [Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/02/bournemouth-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report) described as “dazzling” back in November, is thought to be on Liverpool’s radar as a potential replacement for Mohamed Salah, amid speculation surrounding the Egyptian’s future.

Advert

Following a 3-2 win against Southampton, Salah admitted he was “more out than in”, and admitted no formal contract offer has been made over a new contract, with his current deal set to expire in the summer.

"Well, we are almost in December and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club," the 32-year-old told the media. "I'm probably more out than in.

"You know I have been in the club for many years. There is no club like this. But in the end it is not in my hands. As I said before, it is December and I haven't received anything yet about my future."

![Image 1: Semenyo is said to be on Liverpool's radar (Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltc9de676201c0769c/674c675ba1947e281ca388df/GettyImages-2186213094.jpg)

Semenyo is said to be on Liverpool's radar (Getty)

Advert

Asked if he was disappointed there had been no new offer from Liverpool, Salah said: "Of course, yeah. I love the fans. The fans love me. In the end it is not in my hands or the fans' hands. Let's wait and see.

"I'm not going to retire soon so I'm just playing, focusing on the season and I'm trying to win the Premier League and hopefully the Champions League as well. I'm disappointed but we will see."

----------------------------------------------------------------------

_This article contains affiliate links and LADbible Group might make a commission on anything purchased._

Advert

You can now get Sky Sports [for the equivalent of just £10 in a Black Friday offer](https://fave.co/3CQkl72) believed to be the cheapest price ever for the subscription service.

While Sky Sports isn't available as a standalone deal, it [can be added to the new basic package (which is currently discounted to £19) for just £20](https://fave.co/3CQkl72) - bringing the total monthly fee to £39.

Given that Netflix is usually priced at £10, your [Sky Sports package is the equivalent of just £10.](https://fave.co/3CQkl72) But hurry, as the deal is set to end soon!

Following a 3-2 win against Southampton, Salah admitted he was “more out than in”, and admitted no formal contract offer has been made over a new contract, with his current deal set to expire in the summer.

"Well, we are almost in December and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club," the 32-year-old told the media. "I'm probably more out than in.

"You know I have been in the club for many years. There is no club like this. But in the end it is not in my hands. As I said before, it is December and I haven't received anything yet about my future."

![Image 1: Semenyo is said to be on Liverpool's radar (Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltc9de676201c0769c/674c675ba1947e281ca388df/GettyImages-2186213094.jpg)

Semenyo is said to be on Liverpool's radar (Getty)

Advert

Asked if he was disappointed there had been no new offer from Liverpool, Salah said: "Of course, yeah. I love the fans. The fans love me. In the end it is not in my hands or the fans' hands. Let's wait and see.

"I'm not going to retire soon so I'm just playing, focusing on the season and I'm trying to win the Premier League and hopefully the Champions League as well. I'm disappointed but we will see."

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Ruben Amorim has explained the reason Joshua Zirkzee was picked to start in place of Rasmus Hojlund against Everton.**

[Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-premier-league-goncalo-gregorio-195555-20241119), 39, is set to take charge of his Premier League game at Old Trafford when his side play host to Sean Dyche’s [Everton](https://www.sportbible.com/everton) this afternoon.

He will be looking to build on the 3-2 win against Bodø/Glimt in the Europa League on Thursday evening.

Advert

Ahead of kick-off fans eagerly anticipated the Red Devils’ starting XI but were surprised when Zirkzee was named as part of the line-up instead of [Hojlund](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/rasmus-hojlund-man-united-everton-premier-league-643638-20241201), who scored a brace in the week.

But as per the [Express](https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1983112/man-utd-ruben-amorim-hojlund-zirkzee-everton), Amorim insisted the reason for benching Hojlund was ‘squad rotation'.

“It’s impossible to cope with all the games with the same team," Amorim explained.

Advert

"We have to be ready, we are changing the way we play. Everybody has to play and everybody has to train.

“It’s impossible in three days to recover all the players. We played in a different game against Bodo/Glimt.

"We press a lot, some players were tired, so I prefer for fresh legs and for different characteristics to be harder for the opponents to understand how we are going to play.

“We have returns like Kobbie Mainoo, one of the best young guys in this league. We have international players like I say all the time, so they are ready to win the game.”

Advert

![Image 1: Joshua Zirkzee was picked ahead of Rasmus Hojlund (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt791964bf6651d72d/674c62e732b20531bdad519d/GettyImages-2181992757.jpg)

Joshua Zirkzee was picked ahead of Rasmus Hojlund (Credit:Getty)

Fans gave their thoughts on social media with many expecting the Dane to be given the nod given his impressive performance last time out.

One said: "People need to lay off Zirkzee.

"It's been a handful of games in one of the worst performing United sides in modern history. If only the patience shown for managers extended to players."

Advert

A second added: "Zirkzee this is your moment bro, please take it"

A third commented: "Whatever the rotation is, winning is the only option. Zirkzee had better take his chances."

Zirkzee has struggled to settle since arriving from Bologna in the summer transfer window.

Although he scored the only goal on his debut during a 1-0 win against Fulham on the Premier League's opening night, he has failed to find the net since and has even been linked with a [move away from United](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/joshua-zirkzee-man-utd-transfers-ruben-amorim-234992-20241124).

Zirkzee has struggled to settle since arriving from Bologna in the summer transfer window.

Although he scored the only goal on his debut during a 1-0 win against Fulham on the Premier League's opening night, he has failed to find the net since and has even been linked with a [move away from United](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/joshua-zirkzee-man-utd-transfers-ruben-amorim-234992-20241124).

**Ruben Amorim has explained the reason Joshua Zirkzee was picked to start in place of Rasmus Hojlund against Everton.**

[Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-premier-league-goncalo-gregorio-195555-20241119), 39, is set to take charge of his Premier League game at Old Trafford when his side play host to Sean Dyche’s [Everton](https://www.sportbible.com/everton) this afternoon.

He will be looking to build on the 3-2 win against Bodø/Glimt in the Europa League on Thursday evening.

Advert

Ahead of kick-off fans eagerly anticipated the Red Devils’ starting XI but were surprised when Zirkzee was named as part of the line-up instead of [Hojlund](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/rasmus-hojlund-man-united-everton-premier-league-643638-20241201), who scored a brace in the week.

But as per the [Express](https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1983112/man-utd-ruben-amorim-hojlund-zirkzee-everton), Amorim insisted the reason for benching Hojlund was ‘squad rotation'.

“It’s impossible to cope with all the games with the same team," Amorim explained.

Advert

"We have to be ready, we are changing the way we play. Everybody has to play and everybody has to train.

“It’s impossible in three days to recover all the players. We played in a different game against Bodo/Glimt.

"We press a lot, some players were tired, so I prefer for fresh legs and for different characteristics to be harder for the opponents to understand how we are going to play.

“We have returns like Kobbie Mainoo, one of the best young guys in this league. We have international players like I say all the time, so they are ready to win the game.”

Advert

![Image 1: Joshua Zirkzee was picked ahead of Rasmus Hojlund (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt791964bf6651d72d/674c62e732b20531bdad519d/GettyImages-2181992757.jpg)

Joshua Zirkzee was picked ahead of Rasmus Hojlund (Credit:Getty)

Fans gave their thoughts on social media with many expecting the Dane to be given the nod given his impressive performance last time out.

One said: "People need to lay off Zirkzee.

"It's been a handful of games in one of the worst performing United sides in modern history. If only the patience shown for managers extended to players."

Advert

A second added: "Zirkzee this is your moment bro, please take it"

A third commented: "Whatever the rotation is, winning is the only option. Zirkzee had better take his chances."

data: {"title":"PSG star sparks transfer frenzy with Man City and Liverpool involved in four-way fight to sign him","description":"The Ligue 1 star could be on his way to the Premier League","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/transfer-news/liverpool-man-city-psg-premier-league-ligue-1-sign-539395-20241201","content":"PSG star sparks transfer frenzy with Man City and Liverpool involved in four-way fight to sign him - Transfer News - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**A PSG star could ‘join’ a Premier League club after falling out of favour in Paris – and four European teams ‘want’ to sign him.**

As expected, the French outfit are top of Ligue 1, having won 10 of their 13 games in the league this term, and they are yet to taste defeat domestically at least.

Luis Enrique’s side are seemingly moving away from the ‘superstars’ of the past, with [Lionel Messi](https://www.sportbible.com/lionel-messi), [Neymar](https://www.sportbible.com/neymar) and [Kylian Mbappé](https://www.sportbible.com/kylian-mbappe) all departing the club in recent years.

Advert

However, it is another top player who could be shown the exit door by Enrique.

[Gianluigi Donnarumma](https://www.sportbible.com/gianluigi-donnarumma) was left out of [PSG](https://www.sportbible.com/paris-saint-germain)’s starting XI during the 1-0 Champions League defeat against [Bayern Munich](https://www.sportbible.com/bayern-munich) on Tuesday.

Ironically, his replacement, Matvey Safonov, made an error which led to the Bavarian’s goal.

Advert

The Russian failed to get a solid hand on Joshua Kimmich’s 38th\-minute corner, which allowed defender Kim Min-Jae to head home from close range.

After the match in Germany, the PSG boss explained the reasons for the decision.

"We knew we would face challenges with their pressing, and in such cases, the only free player is often the goalkeeper,” he said.

“In this match, we needed the goalkeeper to help us play out from the back under the opponent’s press,” added Enrique.

Advert

![Image 1: Gianluigi Donnarumma could move on from PSG (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltf92327a7575d9941/674c551432b2053dcfad5192/GettyImages-2187634166.jpg)

Gianluigi Donnarumma could move on from PSG (Credit:Getty)

Although, the Italian ‘keeper returned to the line-up for the French champions' 1-1 draw against Nantes on Saturday, reports from [Gazzetta dello Sport](https://www.gazzetta.it/Calciomercato/30-11-2024/psg-donnarumma-in-discussione-e-un-rinnovo-che-non-arriva.shtml) suggest Inter Milan, Bayern, Manchester City and Liverpool are all ‘monitoring’ his situation.

Donnarumma’s current PSG contract is set to expire in June 2026, and talks of a new deal are “on hold”, according to [Football Italia](https://football-italia.net/inter-man-city-and-liverpool-alert-donnarumma/).

It is unclear, if the player would prefer to join a particular club or even if he wants to move on from the French giants at all.

Advert

A move to Liverpool would arguably be unlikely given the fact they already have Giorgi Mamardashvili joining on July 1, 2025, to add to their already impressive goalkeeping unit of Alisson and Caoimhín Kelleher.

As for Man City, Ederson and backup Stefan Ortega are classy shotstoppers, so one of the pair would likely have to leave the Premier League champions to provide space for the Italian.

Inter’s Yann Sommer is still a top operator, and given the fact Donnarumma came through city rival AC Milan’s academy, a potential deal seems unlikely.

However, a move to Bayern could make sense.

Advert

Manuel Neuer turns 39 in March and has struggled with injury in recent years.

And his contract is set to expire at the end of the season, which could provide an opportunity to bring a new ‘keeper in.

data: {"title":"PSG star sparks transfer frenzy with Man City and Liverpool involved in four-way fight to sign him","description":"The Ligue 1 star could be on his way to the Premier League","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/transfer-news/liverpool-man-city-psg-premier-league-ligue-1-sign-539395-20241201","content":"PSG star sparks transfer frenzy with Man City and Liverpool involved in four-way fight to sign him - Transfer News - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**A PSG star could ‘join’ a Premier League club after falling out of favour in Paris – and four European teams ‘want’ to sign him.**

As expected, the French outfit are top of Ligue 1, having won 10 of their 13 games in the league this term, and they are yet to taste defeat domestically at least.

Luis Enrique’s side are seemingly moving away from the ‘superstars’ of the past, with [Lionel Messi](https://www.sportbible.com/lionel-messi), [Neymar](https://www.sportbible.com/neymar) and [Kylian Mbappé](https://www.sportbible.com/kylian-mbappe) all departing the club in recent years.

Advert

However, it is another top player who could be shown the exit door by Enrique.

[Gianluigi Donnarumma](https://www.sportbible.com/gianluigi-donnarumma) was left out of [PSG](https://www.sportbible.com/paris-saint-germain)’s starting XI during the 1-0 Champions League defeat against [Bayern Munich](https://www.sportbible.com/bayern-munich) on Tuesday.

Ironically, his replacement, Matvey Safonov, made an error which led to the Bavarian’s goal.

Advert

The Russian failed to get a solid hand on Joshua Kimmich’s 38th\-minute corner, which allowed defender Kim Min-Jae to head home from close range.

After the match in Germany, the PSG boss explained the reasons for the decision.

"We knew we would face challenges with their pressing, and in such cases, the only free player is often the goalkeeper,” he said.

“In this match, we needed the goalkeeper to help us play out from the back under the opponent’s press,” added Enrique.

Advert

![Image 1: Gianluigi Donnarumma could move on from PSG (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltf92327a7575d9941/674c551432b2053dcfad5192/GettyImages-2187634166.jpg)

Gianluigi Donnarumma could move on from PSG (Credit:Getty)

Although, the Italian ‘keeper returned to the line-up for the French champions' 1-1 draw against Nantes on Saturday, reports from [Gazzetta dello Sport](https://www.gazzetta.it/Calciomercato/30-11-2024/psg-donnarumma-in-discussione-e-un-rinnovo-che-non-arriva.shtml) suggest Inter Milan, Bayern, Manchester City and Liverpool are all ‘monitoring’ his situation.

Donnarumma’s current PSG contract is set to expire in June 2026, and talks of a new deal are “on hold”, according to [Football Italia](https://football-italia.net/inter-man-city-and-liverpool-alert-donnarumma/).

It is unclear, if the player would prefer to join a particular club or even if he wants to move on from the French giants at all.

Advert

A move to Liverpool would arguably be unlikely given the fact they already have Giorgi Mamardashvili joining on July 1, 2025, to add to their already impressive goalkeeping unit of Alisson and Caoimhín Kelleher.

As for Man City, Ederson and backup Stefan Ortega are classy shotstoppers, so one of the pair would likely have to leave the Premier League champions to provide space for the Italian.

Inter’s Yann Sommer is still a top operator, and given the fact Donnarumma came through city rival AC Milan’s academy, a potential deal seems unlikely.

However, a move to Bayern could make sense.

Advert

Manuel Neuer turns 39 in March and has struggled with injury in recent years.

And his contract is set to expire at the end of the season, which could provide an opportunity to bring a new ‘keeper in.

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Manchester City will hand Pep Guardiola a £200million war chest for the January transfer window, it has been claimed.**

[City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city), bidding for a fifth Premier League in succession, have endured a dismal start to their title defence.

Guardiola had never lost five games in a row before his side’s current run, while [City](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-city/pep-guardiola-face-man-city-champions-league-287930-20241127) have now conceded two or more goals in six successive matches for the first time since 1963.

Advert

Indeed, their last [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) encounter saw [Guardiola’s](https://www.sportbible.com/pep-guardiola) men fall to a 4-0 home loss to Tottenham.

Guardiola, who committed to a new contract last month, has emphasised a dedication to rejuvenate his flailing squad.

"I don't want to run.” he said via [Express.co.uk.](https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1982879/man-city-gift-pep-guardiola-200m-january-warchest-three-huge-transfers-picked) “I want to be there and rebuild the team in many aspects from now on until the end of the season and next season."

Advert

Indeed, according to Express.co.uk, City will enter the January transfer window with a £200million budget.

Guardiola had already allegedly been promised a £100m to strengthen the squad for the second half of the season, if necessary. However, his side’s recent slump is said to have seen that war chest instantly doubled.

The additional funds will reportedly be used to bring in the likes of Real Sociedad central midfielder Martin Zubimendi (£60million), Sporting striker Viktor Gyokeres (£65million) and [Newcastle](https://www.sportbible.com/newcastle-united) midfielder Bruno Guimaraes (£75million).

![Image 1: Guardiola had never lost five games in a row before his side’s current run. (Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt7dfa8c108c5918e6/674c4d7ee84fd189a35b1d8f/GettyImages-2187611034.jpg)

Guardiola had never lost five games in a row before his side’s current run. (Getty)

Advert

You can now get Sky Sports [for the equivalent of just £10 in a Black Friday offer](https://fave.co/3CQkl72) believed to be the cheapest price ever for the subscription service.

While Sky Sports isn't available as a standalone deal, it [can be added to the new basic package (which is currently discounted to £19) for just £20](https://fave.co/3CQkl72) - bringing the total monthly fee to £39.

===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**A former housemate of a Chelsea star has revealed how the player almost saw his opportunity to play in the Premier League slip away from him.**

According to the [Mirror](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/chelsea-news-nicolas-jackson-villarreal-34209249), Iker Goujan, a professional footballer who currently does not have a club, was “inseparable” from the Blues man.

Goujan and the now [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) player lived together for two years as the pairing both played for Spanish outfit Villarreal.

The Spaniard explained how he formed a friendship with [Chelsea](https://www.sportbible.com/chelsea) forward [Nicolas Jackson](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/chelsea/nicolas-jackson-goal-wolves-john-obi-mikel-255782-20240825) after he ‘accidentally’ got the Senegal international sent off in a Villarreal B game.

Advert

Goujan hurled a chair from the bench during the celebration of a 3-2 win over UCAM Murcia, but it was Jackson who was mistakenly shown a red card by the referee – since this, the 25-year-old has felt ‘forever in debt’ to Jackson.

The winger also revealed how he witnessed Jackson’s first opportunity to secure a move to the Premier League slip away from him.

Goujon believes the incident summed up the striker’s determination to get to the elite level of the game.

![Image 1: Nicolas Jackson has impressed this term (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt7bee5ceb07a514a4/674c4be7b3dd3d0d41dfcb05/GettyImages-2186463313.jpg)

Nicolas Jackson has impressed this term (Credit:Getty)

Advert

The report explained how he was driving the forward to the airport ahead of a proposed £20.3m to AFC Bournemouth in January 2023 when Jackson received a WhatsApp message notifying him that the deal had collapsed.

Goujan was there to pick Jason up upon his return to Spain, but the forward remained determined, saying, “Now I need to work harder than ever to earn the opportunity again."

Jackson continued to work hard, scoring 13 goals in 38 appearances for Villarreal in his final season at the club.

Of course, it’s fair to say the failed move was a blessing in disguise as just six months later, Mauricio Pochettino’s Chelsea signed Jackson for a reported fee of £32m, according to [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/66007461).

Advert

Despite the Argentine departing in the summer, new boss Enzo Maresca has shown faith in Jackson, and so far this season, the forward has been in fine form – scoring Premier League goals in 12 games.

His impressive tally currently puts him sixth in the overall goalscoring chart for the 2024/25 season.

Jackson has also added assists to his came, setting up three goals for his teammates.

![Image 2: comment bubble](https://www.sportbible.com/_next/static/media/comment-bubble.c94d2633.svg)0 comments

**A former housemate of a Chelsea star has revealed how the player almost saw his opportunity to play in the Premier League slip away from him.**

According to the [Mirror](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/chelsea-news-nicolas-jackson-villarreal-34209249), Iker Goujan, a professional footballer who currently does not have a club, was “inseparable” from the Blues man.

Goujan and the now [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) player lived together for two years as the pairing both played for Spanish outfit Villarreal.

Enzo Maresca calls out Mykhailo Mudryk despite Chelsea beating Wolves 6-2

The Spaniard explained how he formed a friendship with [Chelsea](https://www.sportbible.com/chelsea) forward [Nicolas Jackson](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/chelsea/nicolas-jackson-goal-wolves-john-obi-mikel-255782-20240825) after he ‘accidentally’ got the Senegal international sent off in a Villarreal B game.

Advert

Goujan hurled a chair from the bench during the celebration of a 3-2 win over UCAM Murcia, but it was Jackson who was mistakenly shown a red card by the referee – since this, the 25-year-old has felt ‘forever in debt’ to Jackson.

The winger also revealed how he witnessed Jackson’s first opportunity to secure a move to the Premier League slip away from him.

Goujon believes the incident summed up the striker’s determination to get to the elite level of the game.

![Image 1: Nicolas Jackson has impressed this term (Credit:Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt7bee5ceb07a514a4/674c4be7b3dd3d0d41dfcb05/GettyImages-2186463313.jpg)

Nicolas Jackson has impressed this term (Credit:Getty)

Advert

The report explained how he was driving the forward to the airport ahead of a proposed £20.3m to AFC Bournemouth in January 2023 when Jackson received a WhatsApp message notifying him that the deal had collapsed.

Goujan was there to pick Jason up upon his return to Spain, but the forward remained determined, saying, “Now I need to work harder than ever to earn the opportunity again."

Jackson continued to work hard, scoring 13 goals in 38 appearances for Villarreal in his final season at the club.

Of course, it’s fair to say the failed move was a blessing in disguise as just six months later, Mauricio Pochettino’s Chelsea signed Jackson for a reported fee of £32m, according to [BBC Sport](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/66007461).

Advert

Despite the Argentine departing in the summer, new boss Enzo Maresca has shown faith in Jackson, and so far this season, the forward has been in fine form – scoring Premier League goals in 12 games.

His impressive tally currently puts him sixth in the overall goalscoring chart for the 2024/25 season.

**Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi both named the toughest opponents they have ever faced.**

[Messi](https://www.sportbible.com/lionel-messi) and [Ronaldo](https://www.sportbible.com/cristiano-ronaldo) are the widely considered to be among the greatest players in history, with the pair having claim 13 Ballon d’Ors collectively.

While football’s most accomplished defenders have on several occasions failed to keep either at bay, a select few have managed to get the better of the superstar pair.

Advert

Ronaldo once admitted that former England, [Chelsea](https://www.sportbible.com/chelsea) and [Arsenal](https://www.sportbible.com/arsenal) left-back Ashley Cole, was the toughest opponent he ever faced.

The pair went head-to-head on several occasions while playing in the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) and on international duty in games between England and Portugal.

"Over the years I had some great battles with Ashley Cole”, Ronaldo told Coach Mag. “He does not give you a second to breathe.

"He was such a tenacious player when he was at his peak, quick, tough in the tackle. You knew it would never be an easy game."

Advert

Meanwhile, Messi's toughest opponent is not quite as famous.

Speaking back in 2020, Messi said via [FourFourTwo](https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/lionel-messi-barcelona-picks-out-his-toughest-ever-opponent-and-its-not-who-you-might-think): "Pablo Maffeo of Girona was the toughest. I've never been one who complains, but that \[match\] was intense!"

The eight-time Ballon d'Or winner was referring to Barcelona's 3-0 win over the Girona back in 2017, when 20-year-old Maffeo, who was then on loan from Manchester City, man-marked him.

Speaking after the game, the defender, who now plays for Mallorca, explained (quotes via [GiveMeSport](https://www.givemesport.com/lionel-messi-who-is-psg-stars-toughest-ever-opponent/)): "Messi told me: 'I've got you here for the whole day' and I said: ’You're the best in the world, I'm not going to leave you.

Advert

![Image 1: Ronaldo has said Cole was his toughest opponent (Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt15f234f536afa9a5/674c5f30ec1a01285b32a2b9/GettyImages-51556106.jpg)

Ronaldo has said Cole was his toughest opponent (Getty)

"He asked me how old I was, if I had been assigned by Manchester City and what it was like there. He said the marking was not pleasant.

"Messi and I were together the whole match. He has asked me a couple of things. He is a good person."

Not nowOK

**Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi both named the toughest opponents they have ever faced.**

[Messi](https://www.sportbible.com/lionel-messi) and [Ronaldo](https://www.sportbible.com/cristiano-ronaldo) are the widely considered to be among the greatest players in history, with the pair having claim 13 Ballon d’Ors collectively.

While football’s most accomplished defenders have on several occasions failed to keep either at bay, a select few have managed to get the better of the superstar pair.

Advert

Ronaldo once admitted that former England, [Chelsea](https://www.sportbible.com/chelsea) and [Arsenal](https://www.sportbible.com/arsenal) left-back Ashley Cole, was the toughest opponent he ever faced.

The pair went head-to-head on several occasions while playing in the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) and on international duty in games between England and Portugal.

"Over the years I had some great battles with Ashley Cole”, Ronaldo told Coach Mag. “He does not give you a second to breathe.

"He was such a tenacious player when he was at his peak, quick, tough in the tackle. You knew it would never be an easy game."

Advert

Meanwhile, Messi's toughest opponent is not quite as famous.

Speaking back in 2020, Messi said via [FourFourTwo](https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/lionel-messi-barcelona-picks-out-his-toughest-ever-opponent-and-its-not-who-you-might-think): "Pablo Maffeo of Girona was the toughest. I've never been one who complains, but that \[match\] was intense!"

The eight-time Ballon d'Or winner was referring to Barcelona's 3-0 win over the Girona back in 2017, when 20-year-old Maffeo, who was then on loan from Manchester City, man-marked him.

Speaking after the game, the defender, who now plays for Mallorca, explained (quotes via [GiveMeSport](https://www.givemesport.com/lionel-messi-who-is-psg-stars-toughest-ever-opponent/)): "Messi told me: 'I've got you here for the whole day' and I said: ’You're the best in the world, I'm not going to leave you.

Advert

![Image 1: Ronaldo has said Cole was his toughest opponent (Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt15f234f536afa9a5/674c5f30ec1a01285b32a2b9/GettyImages-51556106.jpg)

Ronaldo has said Cole was his toughest opponent (Getty)

"He asked me how old I was, if I had been assigned by Manchester City and what it was like there. He said the marking was not pleasant.

"Messi and I were together the whole match. He has asked me a couple of things. He is a good person."

data: {"title":"Liverpool suffer another major injury blow ahead of Man City clash with SIX players set to miss game","description":"Liverpool host City in the Premier League on Sunday afternoon.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/man-city-premier-league-injury-news-setback-405641-20241201","content":"Liverpool suffer another major injury blow ahead of Man City clash with SIX players set to miss game - Liverpool - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Liverpool have been handed another injury setback hours before facing Manchester City in the Premier League.**

Defending champions [City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) travel to Anfield on Sunday afternoon and must avoid defeat if they are to realistically remain in the hunt for the title.

[Pep Guardiola](https://www.sportbible.com/pep-guardiola)'s side are already eight points behind [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) after a disastrous run of results in recent weeks.

Advert

City are without a win in their last six matches after [throwing away a three-goal lead to draw 3-3](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-city/champions-league-record-feyenoord-989392-20241126) with Liverpool boss [Arne Slot](https://www.sportbible.com/arne-slot)'s former side Feyenoord in the Champions League on Tuesday night.

Liverpool are without a number of key players for this weekend's crucial match and have been dealt another setback, with Conor Bradley set to be ruled out until 2025.

Bradley sustained a hamstring injury during his impressive performance against [Real Madrid](https://www.sportbible.com/real-madrid) in the Champions League on Wednesday night, as [Liverpool won 2-0 against the defending European champions.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/cody-gakpo-jude-bellingham-liverpool-real-madrid-483035-20241128)

_The Belfast Telegraph_ [report](https://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/sunday-life/sport/northern-irelands-liverpool-star-conor-bradley-dealt-major-injury-blow/a1693540396.html) that he is now facing a six-week spell on the sidelines, which would rule him out of the entirety of the December fixture schedule – including games against Everton, Spurs and even potentially the match against Manchester United on January 5.

Advert

Fortunately for Liverpool, Trent Alexander-Arnold has returned to fitness after his own hamstring problem and is expected to come back into the side to face City.

However, Ibrahima Konate will miss the match after sustaining a knee injury against Madrid in another major blow for the home side.

[The Frenchman took to Instagram earlier this week](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/ibrahima-konate-liverpool-injury-news-182882-20241129) to hint that he was set for an extended spell on the sidelines.

"So frustrating to pick up this injury right at the end of a great game on Wednesday night," he wrote. "Now we start the recovery process but one thing I promise is I will come back and be the best I can be once again.

Advert

"Thank you for the amazing support at Anfield. Inshallah we will keep going and I will support the team every step of the way."

![Image 1: Slot is without several key players for the visit of City (Image: Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blta4fc30f81435c7c6/674c358d97d0af63d64718ba/GettyImages-2187194769.jpg)

Slot is without several key players for the visit of City (Image: Getty)

Liverpool are still without Diogo Jota (chest) and Alisson (hamstring), with Kostas Tsimikas also sidelined with an ankle problem.

Federico Chiesa, meanwhile, is set to be unavailable as he works his way up to full fitness.

Advert

City are not without problems of their own, with midfield talisman Rodri ruled out for the majority of the season because of an ACL injury.

Mateo Kovacic is also expected to miss the match after picking up a knock on international duty with Croatia earlier this month, while there are also question marks over John Stones and Jeremy Doku.

Oscar Bobb, meanwhile, is not expected to feature as he continues his recovery from a fractured leg.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

_This article contains affiliate links and LADbible Group might make a commission on anything purchased._

Advert

You can now get Sky Sports [for the equivalent of just £10 in a Black Friday offer](https://fave.co/3CQkl72) believed to be the cheapest price ever for the subscription service.

While Sky Sports isn't available as a standalone deal, it [can be added to the new basic package (which is currently discounted to £19) for just £20](https://fave.co/3CQkl72) - bringing the total monthly fee to £39.

Given that Netflix is usually priced at £10, your [Sky Sports package is the equivalent of just £10.](https://fave.co/3CQkl72) But hurry, as the deal is set to end soon!

![Image 1: Slot is without several key players for the visit of City (Image: Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blta4fc30f81435c7c6/674c358d97d0af63d64718ba/GettyImages-2187194769.jpg)

Slot is without several key players for the visit of City (Image: Getty)

Liverpool are still without Diogo Jota (chest) and Alisson (hamstring), with Kostas Tsimikas also sidelined with an ankle problem.

Federico Chiesa, meanwhile, is set to be unavailable as he works his way up to full fitness.

Advert

City are not without problems of their own, with midfield talisman Rodri ruled out for the majority of the season because of an ACL injury.

Mateo Kovacic is also expected to miss the match after picking up a knock on international duty with Croatia earlier this month, while there are also question marks over John Stones and Jeremy Doku.

Oscar Bobb, meanwhile, is not expected to feature as he continues his recovery from a fractured leg.

===============

Not nowOK

**Rasmus Hojlund has sent a warning to an Everton star ahead of the Toffees' clash against Manchester United.**

On Thursday, Ruben Amorim secured his first win as [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) boss after his men came from 2-1 down to [beat Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt in the UEFA Europa League](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-premier-league-bodoglimt-775974-20241129).

The Portuguese will look for his first Premier League victory when United welcome North West rivals [Everton](https://www.sportbible.com/everton) to Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Advert

Against the Toffees, Danish striker [Hojlund](https://www.sportbible.com/rasmus-hojlund) will be hoping he can continue his recent fine form after scoring twice against Bodo/Glimt.

Ahead of the match on Sunday afternoon, Everton star Jesper Lindstrom has revealed his conversation with Hojlund, stating that the United striker has jokingly sent him a warning.

Speaking to the Daily Mail, Lindstrom [said](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-14144227/Rasmus-Hojlunds-former-team-mate-Jesper-Lindstrom-makes-cheeky-request-Man-United-striker-game-against-Everton-Sunday.html): "I texted him after the game to congratulate him on his two goals but told him not to score this weekend.

Advert

"His reply was to tell me he would do his best to score goals."

Lindstrom then spoke about the struggles Hojlund faced early on in his career before moving to Italy and making a name for himself.

The Everton loanee added: "I knew him from when he was about 10 years old. He didn't seem much when he was young. His Danish team didn't believe in him and that's why he left for a club in Austria where he smashed it and then he went to Italy and smashed it there.

"There is a good reason why Rasmus is in Manchester - he's a good player. He has qualities - like you saw on Thursday with some good finishes."

Advert

![Image 1: Rasmus Hojlund scored twice for Manchester United against Bodo/Glimt. Image: Getty](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt67a0e2e9a66a0d34/674c3ebd793fe37ac8ff342f/GettyImages-2187371594.jpg)

Rasmus Hojlund scored twice for Manchester United against Bodo/Glimt. Image: Getty

After initially struggling to adapt to English football, Lindstrom has vowed to get better as he gets more minutes on the pitch.

He said: "As the games go on and with the more game-time I get, the more rhythm I will have - I don’t get cramp 60 minutes anymore, so I feel like I'm getting the rhythm again and I just need the last moment.

"I will do everything I can for them to buy me because I like it here. I like the training, I like the privacy, I like the life here. So hopefully they will buy me, but I have to show them that I'm good enough for them."

**Rasmus Hojlund has sent a warning to an Everton star ahead of the Toffees' clash against Manchester United.**

On Thursday, Ruben Amorim secured his first win as [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) boss after his men came from 2-1 down to [beat Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt in the UEFA Europa League](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-premier-league-bodoglimt-775974-20241129).

The Portuguese will look for his first Premier League victory when United welcome North West rivals [Everton](https://www.sportbible.com/everton) to Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Advert

Against the Toffees, Danish striker [Hojlund](https://www.sportbible.com/rasmus-hojlund) will be hoping he can continue his recent fine form after scoring twice against Bodo/Glimt.

Ahead of the match on Sunday afternoon, Everton star Jesper Lindstrom has revealed his conversation with Hojlund, stating that the United striker has jokingly sent him a warning.

Speaking to the Daily Mail, Lindstrom [said](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-14144227/Rasmus-Hojlunds-former-team-mate-Jesper-Lindstrom-makes-cheeky-request-Man-United-striker-game-against-Everton-Sunday.html): "I texted him after the game to congratulate him on his two goals but told him not to score this weekend.

Advert

"His reply was to tell me he would do his best to score goals."

Lindstrom then spoke about the struggles Hojlund faced early on in his career before moving to Italy and making a name for himself.

The Everton loanee added: "I knew him from when he was about 10 years old. He didn't seem much when he was young. His Danish team didn't believe in him and that's why he left for a club in Austria where he smashed it and then he went to Italy and smashed it there.

"There is a good reason why Rasmus is in Manchester - he's a good player. He has qualities - like you saw on Thursday with some good finishes."

Advert

![Image 1: Rasmus Hojlund scored twice for Manchester United against Bodo/Glimt. Image: Getty](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt67a0e2e9a66a0d34/674c3ebd793fe37ac8ff342f/GettyImages-2187371594.jpg)

Rasmus Hojlund scored twice for Manchester United against Bodo/Glimt. Image: Getty

After initially struggling to adapt to English football, Lindstrom has vowed to get better as he gets more minutes on the pitch.

He said: "As the games go on and with the more game-time I get, the more rhythm I will have - I don’t get cramp 60 minutes anymore, so I feel like I'm getting the rhythm again and I just need the last moment.

"I will do everything I can for them to buy me because I like it here. I like the training, I like the privacy, I like the life here. So hopefully they will buy me, but I have to show them that I'm good enough for them."

Advert

Manchester United fans protest 'unethical' increase in ticket prices – video
============================================================================

Hundreds of [Manchester United](https://www.theguardian.com/football/manchester-united) fans gathered in front of Old Trafford to protest against a recent increase in matchday ticket prices. Prices, which previously started at £40 for adults and £25 for children, were raised to £66 per game, with no concessions for children or pensioners. The move comes as part of the co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe’s efforts to make United more financially sustainable in the face of losses.

Fans outside the ground called the move 'unethical' and directed a number of chants at the ownership. Some Everton supporters also joined their United counterparts while Manchester City and Liverpool fans staged their own protest at Anfield in solidarity to support the Football Supporters' Association's 'Stop Exploiting Loyalty' campaign.

*   [**Manchester United raise member ticket prices to £66 and remove concessions**](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/27/manchester-united-raise-member-ticket-prices-remove-concessions)

============================================================================

Hundreds of [Manchester United](https://www.theguardian.com/football/manchester-united) fans gathered in front of Old Trafford to protest against a recent increase in matchday ticket prices. Prices, which previously started at £40 for adults and £25 for children, were raised to £66 per game, with no concessions for children or pensioners. The move comes as part of the co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe’s efforts to make United more financially sustainable in the face of losses.

I’m lucky enough to have been able to turn a childhood soccer obsession into a 24-year career that has included 13 books, regular columns in the best publications in the world and regular namechecks on Ted Lasso.

Now, I’m writing a weekly newsletter about European football aimed at a US audience, and I hope you consider signing up for it. Each week, alongside my regular column in the Observer, the Guardian’s sister Sunday paper, I’ll be looking at the biggest stories from the weekend’s action, along with issues affecting the global game.

Amorim says he will be ‘judged on the place we finish’ at Manchester United
===========================================================================

*   Manager wants to focus on performance not results
*   Amorim says Rashford ‘can play so much better’

Ruben Amorim has said he will be judged on Manchester United’s finishing position after [Sunday’s 4-0 defeat of Everton](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/dec/01/manchester-united-everton-premier-league-match-report) lifted them to 19 points, four behind Brighton in the final Champions League berth.

Two goals each from Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee gave the Portuguese victory in his first home league match and afterwards he was asked if [Champions League](https://www.theguardian.com/football/championsleague) qualification is realistic.

[Rashford and Zirkzee double up as Manchester United dismantle Everton Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/dec/01/manchester-united-everton-premier-league-match-report)

“I will be judged \[on\] the place that we finish. If I said no you will say that I cannot be a [Manchester United](https://www.theguardian.com/football/manchester-united) manager,” said the 39-year-old. “I want to be honest with our fans – so let’s focus on the performance, not the results. Let’s focus just on the next game and look at the performance. Thursday \[against Bodø/Glimt\] it was 3-2, but I think we deserved more. Today was 4-0 – but I think Everton deserved \[more\]. So let’s focus on the performance.”

On Friday Amorim said that [Rashford has to really want to improve](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/27/marcus-rashford-has-to-really-want-it-to-return-to-top-form-says-ruben-amorim). He was asked if the display against Everton was an example. “Yeah. He can do so much,” said the manager. “He has to continue to improve, he has the ability to do it and he has already proved that. But he can play so much better, like the other guys, so it was a good performance. Tomorrow he has to recover and start thinking about Arsenal \[on Wednesday\].”

Zirkzee’s performance came after the striker had previously struggled for form. “First thing – I need all the players to cope with all the games and he is one of them,” said Amorim. “I just try to help my players, put them in a good position for their characteristics.”

Amorim also explained why Zirkzee was preferred ahead of Rasmus Højlund, [who scored twice against Bodø/Glimt](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/28/manchester-united-bodo-glimt-europa-league-match-report). “It would have been really hard for Rasmus to fight with the two centre-backs of Everton so we tried to push them to a position they are not so comfortable with,” he said. “Josh did a great job, scored two goals which is always important for the confidence, and more important than that is the performance and how he fought in every situation. It was a good day for him and our team.”

Amorim says he will be ‘judged on the place we finish’ at Manchester United
===========================================================================

*   Manager wants to focus on performance not results
*   Amorim says Rashford ‘can play so much better’

Ruben Amorim has said he will be judged on Manchester United’s finishing position after [Sunday’s 4-0 defeat of Everton](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/dec/01/manchester-united-everton-premier-league-match-report) lifted them to 19 points, four behind Brighton in the final Champions League berth.

Two goals each from Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee gave the Portuguese victory in his first home league match and afterwards he was asked if [Champions League](https://www.theguardian.com/football/championsleague) qualification is realistic.

[![Image 3: Joshua Zirkzee scores Manchester United’s fourth goal](https://i.guim.co.uk/img/media/fcab090c5260f923b8727d5240444e8e58ac4d41/99_167_2223_1334/master/2223.jpg?width=460&quality=85&auto=format&fit=max&s=189e8c3b4c6fdaa9b5333bffb84ce6cc) Rashford and Zirkzee double up as Manchester United dismantle Everton Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/dec/01/manchester-united-everton-premier-league-match-report)

“I will be judged \[on\] the place that we finish. Let’s focus just on the next game and look at the performance. Thursday \[against Bodø/Glimt\] it was 3-2, but I think we deserved more. Today was 4-0 – but I think Everton deserved \[more\]. So let’s focus on the performance.”

But he can play so much better, like the other guys, so it was a good performance. Tomorrow he has to recover and start thinking about Arsenal \[on Wednesday\].”

Amorim also explained why Zirkzee was preferred ahead of Rasmus Højlund, [who scored twice against Bodø/Glimt](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/28/manchester-united-bodo-glimt-europa-league-match-report). “It would have been really hard for Rasmus to fight with the two centre-backs of Everton so we tried to push them to a position they are not so comfortable with,” he said. “Josh did a great job, scored two goals which is always important for the confidence, and more important than that is the performance and how he fought in every situation. It was a good day for him and our team.”
